aiida_supercon.workflows.controllers.base module

aiida_supercon.workflows.controllers.config module

Configuration file for SuperCon controllers.

This file contains predefined configurations for different environments and use cases.

get_inputs_and_processclass_from_extras(extras_values, dry_run=False)[source]

Return inputs and process class for the submission of this specific process.

group_label: str

Label of the group to store the process nodes in.

max_concurrent: int

Maximum concurrent active processes.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {'arbitrary_types_allowed': True}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

model_post_init(context: Any, /) → None

This function is meant to behave like a BaseModel method to initialise private attributes.

It takes context as an argument since that’s what pydantic-core passes when calling it.

Parameters:

  • self – The BaseModel instance.

  • context – The context.

order_by: dict | None

Ordering applied to the query of the nodes in the parent group.

overrides: dict | None
parent_group_label: str

Label of the parent group from which to construct the process inputs.

protocol: str
reference_bands: BandsData
unique_extra_keys: tuple | None

Tuple of keys defined in the extras that uniquely define each process to be run.
